acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.015mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat dermal study reported the LC50 value of >500mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 2.16mg/L (4 hours) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >3,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=3.78(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 170.2degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests and mouse in vivo micronucleus tests, though in vitro chromosome aberration tests showed positive (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of moderate to severe eye irritation, with effects persisting for at least 14 days of observation in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In single dose toxicity studies in chickens, "flaccid paralysis without sensory loss (generally, neuromuscular block), somnolency (general suppression of activity), and convulsions" (RTECS (2003)) were found. These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
